meanings.definition: Extract money from (someone) by fine or taxation.
meanings.sent1: The government may mulct individuals for not paying their taxes on time.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to mulct the company for violating environmental regulations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun tried to mulct gold coins from unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: The greedy landlord mulcted his tenants of their hard-earned wages.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox mulcted the chickens of their eggs every night.

meanings.sent1: He had to pay a mulct for parking in the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The mulct imposed on the company was hefty due to the safety violations.
meanings.sent3: The school bully had to pay a mulct for his misbehavior in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent4: The ancient kingdom demanded a mulct from neighboring tribes for protection.
meanings.sent5: The traffic officer issued a mulct to drivers who parked illegally.
